locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Micah's requirements (justice, mercy) and the Psalmist's struggle with the prosperity of the wicked. Focuses on the definition of 'judgment' as self-accusation.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High; uses a dialogical method to unpack the tension between human observation and divine justice.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher acts as a guide leading the soul into the 'sanctuary' of faith, shifting from explaining the text to directing the hearer's internal gaze.
voorbeelden: Enter God’s sanctuary, then, O faithful soul!
Offer your very self.
Be good, all of you who possess goods.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Internal alignment (rectitudo) and the cessation of envy/blasphemy through self-judgment.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicit; acknowledges that what is presented is nothing unless God 'does everything your souls need'.

voorbeelden: We’ve just heard the teachings of Sacred Scripture.
The wicked aren’t really happy.
Wealth is good.
Recall with me now.
Do as he commands.
Shun evil.
Enter with me.
I want to take him at his word.
I don’t want to tire you any longer.
He’ll find that you possess both judgment and justice.
He’ll compensate for what’s lacking in us.
We’ll treat of these matters... some other day.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly linked to the future eschatological unveiling.

voorbeelden: I’ll tell you [what you were doing].
I want to take him at his word.
I say... no good man will weep.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks as a 'mandataris' (vessel) but relies on the authority of the 'sanctuary'.

indicatoren: Long historical recount of the Psalmist's internal monologue (§4-§6).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Provides necessary cognitive framework for the subsequent performative 'entry' into the sanctuary.

missende_elementen: Direct absolution (I forgive you) is replaced by a call to self-accusation.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is moved to act, not just listen.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High; specifically links the act of faith to the outcome of understanding.
voorbeelden: If you correct them with the help of him who created you, you’ll be a just doer of justice.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct interrogation ('What were you doing?') and command ('Enter!').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to force the hearer into the 'sanctuary' of their own conscience.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a mirror for the hearer to see their own potential envy.

actueel_present.gebruik: The immediate act of preaching and entering the sanctuary.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Explanation of Psalm 73) -> Declarative (The sanctuary is open) -> Commissive (God will find you just) -> Directive (Shun evil).
voorbeelden: §7-§8 transitions from the 'what' of the Psalm to the 'now' of the hearer's soul.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: If you're righteous, you'll love everything that's right... As a result, you'll most certainly love God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as an invitation to a spiritual event (entering the sanctuary) rather than a mere lecture on Micah.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Enter with me, if you can, into God’s sanctuary.
sterke_punten.effect: Transforms the sermon from a talk into a journey.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The preacher explicitly invites the hearer to perform the act of 'entering' during the locution.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strong sense of the preacher as a 'consecrated vessel' through which God acts.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes; 'Who answers... if not the Creator?'.
tekstueel_bewijs: What we present to you is nothing unless he himself does everything.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, implicitly through the 'help of heaven'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes; the preacher provides the word, God provides the 'fruit'.
tekstueel_bewijs: May he compensate for what’s lacking in us.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes; the sermon is a 'sowing' for a 'fruitful crop'.
tekstueel_bewijs: What’s hidden today will be unveiled tomorrow.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Strong balance of assertives for foundation and directives for movement.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I declare to you: the wicked man you envy is currently in torment.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a specific declaration of reality.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more unconditional commissives based on God's character.
voorbeeldzinnen: God promises to hold your hand even when your feet slip.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using the 'I-Thou' address to move from biblical history to the hearer's immediate spiritual reality.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of weakness; SAT sees this weakness as the 'felicity condition' for God's power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It does not just persuade the hearer that God is just; it attempts to 'enact' that justice through the hearer's self-judgment.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: The sermon's success is not in the logic of the argument about Psalm 73, but in the illocutionary invitation to 'Enter the sanctuary'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Enter God’s sanctuary, then, O faithful soul!
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Crucial for the 'event' nature of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'diatribe' style (imaginary opponent) which increases the performative tension.
